description: Parks Canada requires an experienced contractor to conduct repairs and reconstruction of an existing fire suppression system(s) in two (2) buildings within Jasper National Park. This work involves decommissioning of an existing glycol system situated within the attic and porches of the Jasper Information Centre and replacing it with a dry system as well as increased coverage within interior portions of the building to meet the requirements of Hazard Occupancy. Additionally, the Maintenance Compound consists of full-scale replacement and expansion of the wet and dry systems due to aging components and to address changes in Hazard Occupancy.
tags: Number of employees is more than 50
Employee turnover rate is more than 20%
General contracting and replacement of fire suppression system.
